taxon_identification.taxon_hierarchy: family asteraceae;tribe astereae;genus erigeron;species inornatus;variety keilii

bio:treatment.description: Stems ascending-erect, 30–60 cm, densely hirsutulous (hairs spreading-deflexed, sometimes ascending-strigose) distally. Leaves: proximal and mid margins with stiff, spreading cilia, faces sparsely strigoso-hispid. Involucres 4.5–5.5 mm.
Dry, grassy slopes and meadows, areas of conifer woodlands;
bio:treatment.discussion: Phyllaries in var. keilii vary from strigose to glabrous and glandular, the glandularity perhaps reflecting hybridization with Erigeron breweri.
